definition: to tower/standing tall and upright (of large building)
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: This is where the ancient village trees stood for centuries.
sentences.chinese: 村中老樹在此矗立幾世紀。

sentences.english: A modern office building is standing on the site of the old bookstore.
sentences.chinese: 一座現代化辦公大樓矗立在這家書店的故址上。

sentences.english: Network marketing is the powerful engine turbo-driving this skyward trend.
sentences.chinese: 網絡營銷是強大引擎渦輪駕駛這矗立趨勢。

sentences.english: The Cullinan rising at West Kowloon waterfront with world-class design and prestige.
sentences.chinese: 天璽矗立西九龍海畔，世界級設計盡顯尊尚氣派。

sentences.english: In the jungles of 1)Guatemala, in Tikal, stands a temple.
sentences.chinese: 在危地馬拉叢林深處的蒂卡爾，矗立着一座神廟。

sentences.english: There were rocks underfoot and boulders about them, rough to the touch like scoria.
sentences.chinese: 粗糙的石頭散落在腳下，也矗立在身邊。

sentences.english: White houses prank where once were huts.
sentences.chinese: 一幢幢的房子傲然矗立在一度只是破敗陋室的地方。

sentences.english: Pictured above, a view of the Marina Bay Sands hotel development June 21.
sentences.chinese: 這是6月21日拍攝的矗立在濱海灣的金沙大酒店。

sentences.english: The glass mountain stands at the corner of Thirteenth Street and Eighth Avenue.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃山矗立於第十三街和第八十大道的拐角處。

sentences.english: In the sunniest spot stood an old mansion surrounded by a deep moat.
sentences.chinese: 在陽光最充足的地方矗立着一棟老舊的大宅邸。

sentences.english: On the eastern bank of the Rhône River in southeastern France lies the city of Avignon.
sentences.chinese: 阿維尼翁城，矗立在法國東南部羅納河的東岸。

sentences.english: Books are lighthouses erected in the great sea of time.
sentences.chinese: 是在時間的汪洋大海中屹然矗立的燈塔。

sentences.english: The Potala stands more superb than ever in the bright sun.
sentences.chinese: 布達拉宮比過去更加壯麗地矗立在燦爛的陽光中。

sentences.english: I stood in the songs of childhood Yin, the backdrop of the poetry.
sentences.chinese: 我的童年矗立在歌吟裏，掩映在詩詞中。

sentences.english: Next to the church stands the medieval bell tower of St. Urban.
sentences.chinese: 中世紀的聖歐本鐘樓矗立在大教堂的邊上。

definition: to stand for a long time
to tower/to stand straight (of person's bearing)
to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
to be situated/to be located (of a building)
to be situated/located at (of building)/also written 坐落[zuo4 luo4]
